perturbation.original_text: a.As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text: a.As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ. All references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate,' the modified text creates ambiguity. It's unclear if obligations tied to VNBJ still exist despite the agreement ceasing to have effect. Later clauses depend on the termination of rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: b.As of the VNBZ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBZ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBZ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBJ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text: b.As of the VNBZ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBZ. All references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBJ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.explanation: Similar to the previous change, removing 'all rights and obligations with respect to VNBZ under the JV Agreement shall terminate' creates ambiguity regarding the status of obligations related to VNBZ. This directly contradicts subsequent clauses (such as Article 2) that refer back to the termination of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable', this clause now suggests parties remain liable for breaches *even after* the closing. Given the amended clauses 1.1 and 1.2 where obligations may not clearly terminate, it leads to ambiguity.  Is there a perpetual responsibility, even after obligations are intended to be cleared through the closing?
